intro: Hieracium trichocauloides, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
